result.execSummary:
The defendant Krystal Marie Huck was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Possession of Controlled Substance [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Search for employment commensurate with disability and complies with SSDI program limitations.

Bonds forfeited and applied to restitution owing in 15CM91 & 15CF148.

Submit to an AODA assessment and comply with recommendations.

No contact with victims L.V.H., D.D. or their residences.  No contact with Tomah Wal-Mart.

Write a letter of apology to D.D., victim in 15CM256, and submit to agent for approval.

Random drug testing as deemed appropriate by agent.

Cooperate with home county child support agency to pursue child support to help meet the needs of her children and herself.

No consumption or possession of alcoholic beverages.  No entering bars, taverns or liquor stores.

No consumption or possession of any controlled substances not legally prescribed to defendant and take prescribed medications exactly as  directed to be taken.

Psychological evaluation and comply with counseling recommendations.

No drug paraphernalia.

DEFENDANT ENTITLED TO 26 DAYS SENTENCE CREDIT IF PROBATIOIN IS REVOKED.

to Detain
for Pretrial Conference & Return

Defendant appears via VTC with Attorney Hammer.  Court reinstates previous bond and conditions.
Pretrial Conference- September 25, 2017 @ 1:30 p.m.
Plea/Schedule- October 30, 2017 @ 10:00 a.m.

No controlled substances without a valid prescription in own name.
Take all prescribed medication as prescribed.
No consumption or possession of alcohol.  No entering taverns, bars or liquor stores for any purpose.
DEFENDANT MUST COMPLY WITH THE BOND MONITORING PROGRAM.  
DEFENDANT MAY ONLY BE RELEASED ON WEEKDAYS (EXCLUDING HOLIDAYS) FROM 8:00 A.M. UNTIL 6:00 P.M.  DEFENDANT MUST GO IMMEDIATELY TO THE JUSTICE PROGRAMS OFFICE UPON SIGNING OF BOND AND/OR RELEASE.  THE BOND MONITORING PROGRAM IS LOCATED IN THE MONROE COUNTY JUSTICE CENTER AT 112 SOUTH COURT STREET, ROOM 1008, SPARTA, WI.
CURFEW FROM 7:00 P.M. UNTIL 7:00 A.M. EXCEPT FOR WORK, TREATMENT OR TESTING PURPOSES ONLY IF APPROVED BY BOND MONITORING AHEAD OF TIME.
The Bond Monitoring Program may approve defendant to go through testing with Justice Sanctions in La Crosse County.
